subject: Physical Fitness
title: Calories In vs Calories Out
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Calories In vs Calories Out.

hook.text: Weight loss seems simple: eat less, move more. But the equation is far more nuanced than it appears.

buildup.text: Energy balance determines weight change. A surplus stores energy; a deficit forces the body to burn reserves.

discovery.text: Your body adjusts. Cut calories and metabolism slows, hunger rises, and movement decreases unconsciously.

twist.text: Two people eating identical calories can gain different amounts. Gut bacteria, hormones, and genetics matter.

climax.text: Calories in vs out is real physics. But how your body processes those calories is complex biology.

punchline.text: The calorie equation works. The variables just aren't as simple as they seem.

quiz.question: Why isn't weight management as simple as calories in vs calories out?
options: The body adjusts metabolism, hunger, and movement in response to calorie changes
Only protein calories count for weight
